fields.name: Chemka (Kikuletwa) Hot Springs
fields.description: Palm-fringed thermal spring near Moshi with clear turquoise pools popular for swimming and picnics.
fields.short_description: Turquoise hot spring near Moshi.
fields.accessibility: About 45–60 minutes by road from Moshi; short steps to pool edge.
fields.walking_distance_from_road: Direct access to pool; minimal walking.

fields.name: Lake Manyara Hot Springs
fields.description: Thermal vents and pools within the Lake Manyara area; part of groundwater systems visited by wildlife and birds.
fields.short_description: Thermal hot springs near Lake Manyara.
fields.accessibility: Accessible by road inside Lake Manyara NP; short walk on park tracks.

fields.name: Ngare Sero (Maji Moto)
fields.description: Geothermal springs close to Lake Natron used traditionally and visited during northern circuit tours.
fields.short_description: Thermal springs near Lake Natron.
fields.accessibility: Road access via Mto wa Mbu/Lake Natron tracks; 4x4 recommended.

fields.name: Kikuletwa Springs (alternative)
fields.description: Popular day-visit hot spring with picnic facilities, shaded areas and clean swimming water.
fields.short_description: Popular hot spring oasis between Arusha and Moshi.
fields.accessibility: Easy by road from Moshi/Arusha; signage from main road.
fields.walking_distance_from_road: Immediate access from small parking area.

fields.name: Isimila Stone Age Site
fields.description: Eroded sandstone pillars and prehistoric tool finds near Iringa; site with a small on-site museum and guided trails.
fields.short_description: Stone Age archaeological site near Iringa.
fields.accessibility: Accessible by road from Iringa town; short walk to site from parking.

fields.name: Olduvai Gorge
fields.description: World-famous paleoanthropological site with museum and guided trails where early human fossils were discovered.
fields.short_description: Legendary paleoanthropological site in Ngorongoro Conservation Area.
fields.accessibility: By road from Ngorongoro/Arusha; entrance and guide recommended.

fields.name: Laetoli Footprints
fields.description: Preserved hominin footprints in volcanic ash dated to ~3.6 million years; guided visits arranged via local conservation authority.
fields.short_description: Ancient hominin footprints near Olduvai.
fields.accessibility: Guided access from nearby centres; road then short guided walk.

fields.name: Kilwa Kisiwani Ruins
fields.description: UNESCO World Heritage Swahili ruins with mosques, palaces and fortifications that tell the history of Indian Ocean trade.
fields.short_description: UNESCO Swahili stone-town ruins.
fields.accessibility: Accessible by dhow from Kilwa Masoko; local guides available.

fields.name: Sanje Waterfalls
fields.description: Multi-tiered waterfall in Udzungwa Mountains NP; long rainforest hike with chances to see endemic primates and birds.
fields.short_description: Tall rainforest waterfall in Udzungwa NP.
fields.accessibility: Trail from park gate; guided hikes recommended.

fields.name: Kalambo Falls
fields.description: Impressive high uninterrupted waterfall on the Tanzania–Zambia border, set in rugged landscape with archaeological interest nearby.
fields.short_description: High waterfall near Lake Tanganyika.
fields.accessibility: Road access then trekking; remote area so planning required.

fields.name: Materuni Waterfall
fields.description: Lush waterfall on Kilimanjaro slopes near Materuni village, combined with coffee plantation cultural visits and short hikes.
fields.short_description: Coffee-farm waterfall near Moshi.
fields.accessibility: Car to village then 30–40 minute hike.

fields.name: Uru Waterfalls
fields.description: Hidden cascade on Kilimanjaro’s lower slopes with natural pools and shady forest paths.
fields.short_description: Secluded waterfall on Kilimanjaro slopes.
fields.accessibility: Car access to trailhead then short hike.

fields.name: Kinukamori Waterfall
fields.description: Accessible waterfall near Marangu offering quick walks and scenic views of plantations and village life.
fields.short_description: Easy-access waterfall in Marangu.
fields.accessibility: Short walk from Marangu village.

fields.name: Kalenga Waterfalls
fields.description: Waterfall near historical Kalenga, combining natural pools with nearby cultural/historical sites.
fields.short_description: Waterfall near Kalenga (Iringa).
fields.accessibility: Road access then short hike to viewpoint.

fields.name: Matema Beach
fields.description: Sandy beach on the northern shore of Lake Nyasa with clear water, local fishing villages and mountain backdrop.
fields.short_description: Lake Nyasa beach backed by Livingstone Mountains.
fields.accessibility: Road access from Kyela/Mbeya then local tracks.

fields.name: Saadani Beach Viewpoint
fields.description: Coastal-safari interface where Saadani NP meets the Indian Ocean; beaches, mangroves and wildlife-viewing opportunities.
fields.short_description: Unique beach and savanna interface in Saadani NP.
fields.activities: beach walks, boat safaris, game drives
fields.accessibility: Road access from Bagamoyo/Pangani; lodge-based access recommended.

fields.name: Oldoinyo Lengai
fields.description: Active carbonatite volcano sacred to the Maasai; famous for black ash summit and sunrise climbs above Lake Natron.
fields.short_description: Active volcano near Lake Natron.
fields.activities: mountain hiking, sunrise viewing, cultural tours
fields.accessibility: Road to Lake Natron then multi-hour hike; guides required.

fields.name: Lake Chala
fields.description: Steep-walled crater lake on the Kenya–Tanzania border; deep clear waters and unique flora and fauna including endemic tilapia.
fields.short_description: Deep crater lake east of Kilimanjaro.
fields.accessibility: Remote tracks from Rombo; trail down steep cliffs to shoreline.

fields.name: Lake Ngozi
fields.description: Large highland crater lake in the Poroto Mountains with forested caldera walls and cool montane climate.
fields.short_description: High-elevation crater lake near Mbeya.
fields.accessibility: Road to Tukuyu then short walk to rim viewpoints.

fields.name: Rubondo Island Chimp Trail
fields.description: Forest trails for chimpanzee viewing, sitatunga and rich birdlife on Rubondo Island in Lake Victoria.
fields.short_description: Chimp trekking and island wildlife on Rubondo.
fields.accessibility: Boat transfers from Lake Victoria ports; island lodges coordinate visits.
fields.walking_distance_from_road: Island trails typically <3 km from landing points.

fields.name: Mafia Island Marine Park
fields.description: Coral reefs, seasonal whale shark aggregations, turtles and strong community-managed marine conservation programmes.
fields.short_description: Top diving and whale-shark area at Mafia.
fields.activities: scuba diving, snorkeling, whale shark excursions
fields.accessibility: Boat or small plane from Dar es Salaam; dive operators available.

fields.name: Amboni Caves
fields.description: Largest limestone cave system in East Africa near Tanga with cultural significance and guided tours.
fields.short_description: Extensive limestone caves near Tanga.
fields.accessibility: 8 km from Tanga town; road and short walk to cave entrance.
fields.walking_distance_from_road: Short guided walk into cave system.

fields.name: Bagamoyo Historical Town
fields.description: Historic Swahili town and former caravan terminus with museums, churches and colonial-era buildings.
fields.short_description: Historic Swahili trading town near Dar es Salaam.
fields.activities: walking tours, museum visits, cultural experiences
fields.accessibility: By road from Dar es Salaam; town easily walkable.

fields.name: Engaruka Ruins
fields.description: Remains of an ancient irrigated agricultural complex with stone-faced terraces and canals demonstrating advanced early farming.
fields.short_description: Ancient irrigation ruins near Mto wa Mbu.
fields.accessibility: Dirt-road access north of Mto wa Mbu; guided visits recommended.
